stimulusHtml: The trend shown in the graph between the 1900s and the 1940s can best be described as a result of

features.html:
• The Number of Migrants data for the 10 bars are as follows:

    • 1900s: 200,000

    • 1910s: 440,000

    • 1920s: 810,000

    • 1930s: 390,000

    • 1940s: 1,450,000

    • 1950s: 1,110,000

    • 1960s: 1,000,000

    • 1970s: 800,000

    • 1980s: 600,000

    • 1990s: 510,000

choicesHtml: a boost in educational opportunities in Northern states
an increase in the demand for jobs in Northern cities
an influx of migrants from Afro-Caribbean regions
an improvement in Southern agriculture production
